resources.string: Make sure that the directions in which the user can move are mentioned in the description
Make sure to set the currentRoom and endRoom ids.
Make sure that objects that can be interacted with are added to the object list and mentioned in the description.
Make sure that items that can be picked up are added to the items list.
When describing the exits in a room, don't specify where they lead.
Only add description to the last room as it ends the game.
Make sure that all rooms, moves, objects, and items have unique ids to the game.
Generate a %1$s themed game with the following structure.
Something went wrong. Please try again.

The user issued the command: %1$s. Determine the action the user wants to take based on the following: Move: Check if it matches a valid move from %2$s. If valid, return the move ID with confirmation feedback. Pick Up: If not a move, check if the user wants to pick an item from %3$s. If yes, return the item ID with confirmation feedback. Interact: If not a move or item, check if the user is trying to interact with an object from %4$s. If the interaction requiredItem is null, return the object ID with confirmation feedback. If it requires an item, verify its presence in inventory %5$s. If present, return the object ID with confirmation feedback. If not, provide feedback about the missing item. Invalid: If none of the above, analyze the room description "%6$s" and provide feedback for the invalid command. Respond with the given structure.
